lab.summary: Long-range subspace arrays begin reporting inconsistent readings from a nearby nebula.

answers.text: Recalibrate sensors with localized reference points and verify through triangulated starbase data.
answers.details: Ensures accurate readings through cross-verification and methodical recalibration.

answers.text: Dispatch a probe to relay clean telemetry for remote recalibration.
answers.details: Adds confirmation data but delays result and risks probe loss in interference.

answers.text: Ignore anomalies assuming temporary distortion from solar activity.
answers.details: Quick resolution but risks missing early detection of a significant subspace phenomenon.

lab.summary: A sudden microbial bloom begins affecting plant growth aboard ship.

answers.text: Quarantine the section, analyze samples under containment, and sequence DNA for cross-species contamination.
answers.details: Prevents contamination and allows identification for targeted remediation.

answers.text: Adjust environmental controls to inhibit growth while continuing operations.
answers.details: Reduces spread but risks mutation or adaptation if cause is not removed.

answers.text: Flush hydroponics and reseed with sterilized stock immediately.
answers.details: Resolves symptoms but loses valuable samples and data for analysis.

lab.summary: A passing quantum filament interferes with navigation and power regulation.

answers.text: Divert power to deflector shields, recalibrate sensors, and maintain minimum safe distance.
answers.details: Balances safety and data collection while avoiding destructive interference.

answers.text: Attempt to harness the filament’s energy output for study.
answers.details: Potential discovery but dangerously unpredictable energy levels.

answers.text: Proceed through filament at reduced speed to minimize exposure.
answers.details: Risky maneuver that could cause cascading failures in ship systems.

lab.summary: Lab organisms show accelerated evolutionary traits after transporter exposure.

answers.text: Isolate the specimens and analyze transporter logs for pattern anomalies.
answers.details: Preserves biosecurity while identifying possible transporter malfunction or breakthrough.

answers.text: Continue observation to study accelerated evolution under containment.
answers.details: Valuable research opportunity but risks spreading unknown mutations.

answers.text: Terminate specimens to prevent any biological threat.
answers.details: Guarantees safety but destroys potentially groundbreaking data.

lab.summary: Localized graviton fluctuations threaten sensor calibration and could distort nearby starship traffic.

answers.text: Plot and map fluctuation fields, issue navigational warnings, and record gravimetric readings for later modeling.
answers.details: Collects critical data safely while warning others to avoid hazard zone.

answers.text: Attempt to stabilize graviton field with inverse-frequency pulses.
answers.details: Proactive but risky; may worsen oscillations if miscalculated.

answers.text: Ignore readings until interference subsides naturally.
answers.details: Avoids immediate risk but forfeits vital research opportunity.

lab.summary: A newly recovered artifact emits intermittent subspace bursts of unknown origin.

answers.text: Transfer artifact to a secure containment field and perform spectral analysis under level-10 isolation.
answers.details: Ensures safety while preserving data for full spectrum analysis.

answers.text: Attempt direct interface using adaptive holo-interface to interpret data.
answers.details: Could yield faster insight but risks activating unknown systems.

answers.text: Store artifact in cargo hold until experts can arrive.
answers.details: Delays research and leaves potential hazard unsecured.

lab.summary: Sensor scans indicate ecological collapse following recent terraforming efforts.

answers.text: Dispatch planetary science teams to analyze atmosphere, soil, and water chemistry.
answers.details: Identifies systemic causes and enables targeted environmental corrections.

answers.text: Recommend immediate evacuation of all colonists pending investigation.
answers.details: Protects lives but disrupts long-term colony infrastructure unnecessarily.

answers.text: Assume data error and recheck scans after orbital cycle.
answers.details: Avoids premature alarm but risks worsening irreversible collapse.

lab.summary: Chronometric echoes appear in subspace, mimicking transmissions from the ship’s own logs.

answers.text: Record and isolate signals for analysis while verifying no system self-interference.
answers.details: Preserves temporal integrity and allows safe scientific study of the phenomenon.

answers.text: Attempt to respond to the echoes to test for causality.
answers.details: Might reveal information about temporal displacement but risks paradox formation.

answers.text: Block signal frequency to prevent feedback into communications array.
answers.details: Prevents loop formation but discards potential temporal data.

lab.scenario: Crystal Growth in Warp Core Housing
lab.summary: Crystalline structures begin forming around plasma conduits.

answers.text: Deactivate plasma flow, analyze composition, and remove crystals under containment.
answers.details: Eliminates hazard and yields data on possible energy-matter anomalies.

answers.text: Increase plasma flow to burn off formations safely.
answers.details: Quickly clears obstruction but risks thermal stress damage.

answers.text: Ignore as minor mineral accumulation from coolant condensation.
answers.details: Assumes harmless residue; could result in containment breach.

lab.summary: Microscopic self-replicating nanites appear to be modifying biobed systems autonomously.

answers.text: Seal bay, isolate network interfaces, and apply EM dampening field to deactivate rogue nanites.
answers.details: Halts spread immediately and preserves samples for analysis.

answers.text: Attempt to communicate with nanites using standard Federation protocols for machine intelligence.
answers.details: Potential diplomatic breakthrough if sentient but carries unknown risk.

answers.text: Purge nanites by venting atmosphere and decontaminating equipment.
answers.details: Guaranteed neutralization but destroys research potential.

lab.summary: Spectroscopy identifies matter inconsistent with known periodic elements.

answers.text: Collect controlled samples via remote drones for lab synthesis.
answers.details: Enables safe isolation and replication for study without endangering ship.

answers.text: Bring direct samples aboard for immediate study.
answers.details: Yields faster data but risks contamination or instability.

answers.text: Share findings but postpone study until support vessels arrive.
answers.details: Defers discovery and risks claim disputes from other factions.

lab.summary: Thermal readings indicate life signatures beneath an ice crust.

answers.text: Deploy drilling probe to extract samples without contaminating local biosphere.
answers.details: Preserves planetary protection directives while advancing exobiology research.

answers.text: Land a manned away team to drill and retrieve specimens directly.
Mark location for future missions and withdraw.
answers.details: Ensures safety but may lose unique biological data to natural shifts.

lab.summary: Survey instruments detect lethal but fluctuating gamma radiation pockets.

answers.text: Cease all operations, recalibrate shields, and remap area from a safe orbit.
answers.details: Protects crew and collects useful data safely for astrophysics analysis.

answers.text: Continue survey using automated drones only.
answers.details: Maintains mission pace but risks losing equipment.

answers.text: Ignore transient spikes assuming background variation.
answers.details: Neglects possible discovery of exotic radiation source.

lab.summary: Spectral analysis reveals manufactured alloys within a comet nucleus.

answers.text: Collect fragments for metallurgical analysis and track orbital decay.
answers.details: Preserves integrity and uncovers evidence of artificial construction.

answers.text: Attempt to tractor comet to stable orbit for long-term study.
answers.details: Facilitates extended research but risks structural fragmentation.

answers.text: Broadcast discovery immediately to claim priority.
answers.details: Draws recognition but may violate First Contact or artifact protocols.
